title: Karnataka bandh: Shops closed in parts of many districts, fewer vehicles on roads - The News Minute
content:
1. Karnataka bandh: Shops closed in parts of many districts, fewer vehicles on roads  The News Minute
  2. Karnataka Hijab Ban: Complete Shutdown At Some Places After Muslim Organizations Call For Bandh  India Today
  3. "One of Us Now": Karnataka Student Told In Class After She Removes Hijab  NDTV
  4. Hijab Verdict : How Preconceived Notions May Have Trumped Judicial Reasoning  Live Law - Indian Legal News
  5. Hijab controversy: The hidden agenda is Muslim consolidation  Firstpost
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: A day after the Karnataka High Court delivered its verdict ruling the hijab a non-essential practice under Islam, Muslim groups across Karnataka had called for a bandh on March 17 in protest. In Bengaluru, parts of the city wore a deserted look on Thursday, March 17, in areas including Commercial Street and Shivajinagar in the heart of Bengaluru, as several shops had downed their shutters and fewer vehicles were seen on the roads.
